Authors:
Monika Chandani Dayarathne, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe,
Bandarupalli devadatha, Pranami Abeywickrama, E.B. Gareth Jones, Putarak
Chomnunti, Veluri Venkateswara Sarma, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Modern taxonomic approaches to identifiying diatrypaceous
fungi from marine habitats, a novel genus Halocryptovalsa and expansion
of Halodiatrype
Keywords:
new taxa, herbarium, mangroves, morphology, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Diatrypaceous fungi are associated with a large number of
host species, including Avicennia spp., Halosarceia halocnemoides,
Kandelia candel, Salicornia sp., Rhizophora apiculata and Suaeda
fruticosa, in marine habitats. Accurate morphological identification of
individual taxa of this family is rather difficult, as previous
classifications are confused. In this study, we determined the
phylogenetic and morphological relationships of marine diatrypaceous
taxa. A novel genus Halocryptovalsa is established to accommodate
Halocryptovalsa salicorniae sp. nov. and Halocryptovalsa avicenniae
comb. nov. Three novel species Diatrype mangrovei, Cryptosphaeria
avicenniae and Cryptosphaeria halophila are also introduced from
mangroves. Halodiatrype is amended with asexual morph characters. This
study provides a detailed account of all known marine diatrypaceous
ascomycetes using both morphological and phylogenetic data.
